6.3.17  6:15 pm   I know you already have answered a few questions on here about defining music, and I like your thoughts on it. Really, it doesn't matter what the definition of music is. It has no clear definition, and yet it still exists, people make it and people listen to it and buy it. There's lots of different ways people have defined music.. some have given really simplified answers. Edgard Varese has one of the most famous definitions of music as being "organized sound." Frank Zappa said "a composer is a guy who goes around forcing his will on unsuspecting air molecules, often with the assistance of unsuspecting musicians." Barney Childs' definition is that "A piece of music is simply a chunk of time you are paying attention to with your ears." Others have given definitions that are more abstract, like Beethoven ("Music is the one incorporeal entrance into the higher world of knowledge which comprehends mankind but which mankind cannot comprehend"). You said "the onl y way i really know of to define it is by making some of it, or finding some of it to listen to. then you can go, "ah, that's music. i think"" .... But if music is in the eye (or ear) of the beholder... where does that leave the composer/creator/performer? If someone makes something that they personally intended to be music, then shouldn't it music rather or not you or I (or any other listener) interprets it as such?

     it is your choice what to call music. you don't even have to decide. might be more fun that way anyway

      re-recording old songs would always be nice. but there are hundreds more songs that have not yet been recorded at all. out of all the many things i desperately want to do, re-recording songs is maybe the 22nd priority

6.3.17  2:21 pm   So on Instagram you posted a picture of a rotated, purple, California shaped outline against a black background. The picture implies to many of your fans, including me, that you have started work on a music video for your most recent song, "In California". However, on the 6.1.17 11:21 pm question you said "In California" would not be getting a video. And on the 6.2.17 6:16 am question you were asked about the topic of the next video to which you replied, "what video". So these questions imply to your fans that you aren't making a video at all and are starting on the next song project. But that still leaves the question: If you're not making a video then what was the Instagram photo from? (Sorry, btw, if I am completely off about all of this and you have been repeating the answer throughout my question.)

     the instagram picture was posted right before the song was released, as a subtle indication of the upcoming release of the song. the graphic was made specifically for instagram, but i also used it in the title graphic for the song

6.3.17  2:17 pm   for the videos that go with the songs do the dates correspond to when they were filmed or when the songs were recorded

     the date the video was completed and/or first released as a video

6.3.17  1:53 pm   how different is hotewig to how you first envisioned it?

     it's about the same

6.3.17  1:34 pm   Can you explain double flats/double sharps?

     it's kind of like you are on tour around the world and you are setting your watch further ahead as you go through each time zone, and now you've gone around the world more than twice, so you've set your watch forward 48 hours. you might think that's not necessary, but each step of the way made sense

6.3.17  12:02 pm   In "The Song Song", you say "Metropolitan Avenue at Lorimer Street". Did you live here or something or did you just write a song about that place?

     that is approximately the location where i was when i recorded it. there was a rehearsal studio there at the time. i'm not sure if it is still there, that was in august 2009

6.3.17  11:32 am   Hey bill, one thing I love about you is you do your own thing with no regards as to what anyone thinks, but judging by recent answers it looks like it's starting to affect you.

     it always affects me a little, and then i grow stronger. and then it intensifies more, and then i grow stronger more. this process has been going on for quite some time

      When people feel entitled for things from you, ads/no ads, spotify, free content, capital letters etc... I understand this question page is your survival strategy but as a humble observer from afar, it looks like this page is bringing more negativity than you deserve. You don't owe us anything, and if you need to take a break from answering questions and focus on your art, it would be more than reasonable. HoJ and HOTEWIG only made you more famous, and the more famous you get, the more you will receive negativity like that. If you don't properly know how to deal with it now, it might just get worse.

     it steadily gets more intense, both positive and negative. this is to be expected

      With all that being said, do you think your survival strategy should change or remain intact?

     it seems to be going fine

6.3.17  11:13 am   You mentioned at 6.1.17 5:29 pm that you were working on a project. Will we get to see this project?

     it depends if you can see with your ears

6.3.17  10:09 am   Are you going to make a music video out of "in california"?

     no

      Do you think you will get tired of making songs and get back to other types of content?

     i've barely scratched the surface

      Do you think you will manage to finish the song idea list which started in 2009?

     the list was actually compiled in 2012, even though the songs date back to 2009. i don't think there would be nearly enough time in my lifetime to finish all of them

      Are you going to make a song about something else than USA but in the same categories(I mean other countries like Russia, New Zealand, Latvia)?

     most of my songs are not about geography

      Using the time between "history of the entire world i guess" and "in california" I calculated that you will upload approximately 15 songs a year. Do you think this is accurate?

     not quite

     If not, do you think you will make more or less?

     more. i wanted to try out a few different techniques with california because it was the first one, so i just wanted to make sure i knew what i was doing. my target is 1 song a week. for many songs that will be a breeze, such as next week's song which is already finished. but for example if i pick one where the writing is only 5% done, and the length is supposed to be 3 minutues, that means i have to write the entire thing and record it. might possibly take up to 2 weeks.

      Are you going to make songs about numbers?

     numbers are nice to use in songs. but most of my songs are not 'about' 1 thing or another

     Even if you made any, are you going to make more? Does the use of the "Enter" button make these questions easier to read and operate with?

     yes, although line breaks don't show up when it's posted. but when i answer each question seperately, there will be line breaks there regardless of whether you put them there

      Which is the better place to check the solutions to games or challenges you did not give answer to: the questions page or your e-mail?

     which games and challenges

      Does infinity cause glitches in mathematics? For example there is a sum "1+2+3+4+5+...=-(1/12)" and the solution makes sense if proper research is done!

     infinity might cause glitches in finite mathematics

      Which one do you believe to be true: "quality is better than quantity", "quality is as good(or bad) as quantity" or "quality is worse than quantity"?

     quantity is nice if the quality is also good

     Which one of these strategies do you prefer to follow: "quality over quantity", "quality along quantity" or "quality under quantity"?

     quality + quantity

      Thanks for finally uploading the alphabet ordering strategies and being awesome!

     you have to just try different ways until you find a way that feels right

6.3.17  2:56 am   in parts of your songs where you speak (not sing), are those originally in the chart or were they added when you're recording?

     examples of vocal parts that were added during the recording and not previously written are:
          from 'we could just get high': the extra vocals near the end "we could get high, baby... book a flight, ... go to china baby, etc..." also the high "yeah" on the end.
          new canaan: before second verse- "there's something else i was gonna say." and all the outtro banter. also the spoken pre-intro
          tuesday: at the very end- "it'll be tuesday and that's ok"
          the road: added the word "so" at the end
          i can play: the line about the mall at the very end
           i'm crazy / it's raining: spoken lines in outtro "it's changing, i'm famous, i'm a baby, etc"
          it's gonna be alright: spoken lines in the intro, the whisper at the very end
          all u gotta do is: i think the spoken repeat of the last lyric at the very end
          i'm confused: spoken title line at the very end
          and surely many others

6.3.17  2:54 am   Did you follow your chart for your latest song exactly as written or did you change up some chords/notes/lyrics here and there with new bits?

     the version i found from late 2013 was all set. i adhered to that version. that includes melody, chords, lyrics, exact tempo suggestion (112).

     details which were included in that version:
          the exact road map (except shortened the breaks after the choruses, and i let the end go on longer without fading).
          the exact chords in the pre-choruses.
          the answer riff over those chords in both pre-choruses (the organ riff, the one that's the same in both pre-choruses).
          the stray "in"s near the end.
          the modulation in the second chorus.

     details which were added during the recording (2017)
          the pre-intro noises
          all other auxiliary fills and instrumental riffs in response to lines (besides the main one in the late 2nd/3rd verses)
          vocal "yes i went there"
          small vocal prefixes before some of the states ("up in" "even in" etc)
          vocal "what the hell was i gonna say" near the end
          a slight melody variation in the second chorus, on "fool, ohh" which was originally the same as "rules, ohh" from the first chorus
          vocal harmonies

6.3.17  2:47 am   when i listen to "school" i think it's a deep statement on human nature, and more specifically, ignorance in a depressing way. school is a metaphor for knowledge in general. the lines "i don't wanna go to school, because i'm stupid, i don't want nobody tellin me what to do or how to get through this" to me seem like a statement on how people prefer to figure out life on their own way. they think they can wing it, make it up as they go, improvise. the next lines "i don't want nobody tellin me how to think, tellin me how to sing, tellin me how to do everything" really emphasize this point. but in the next lines, the true intentions behind the narrator's willful ignorance is revealed. "i don't wanna be afraid, of criminals, i don't wanna be afraid, of dangerous politicians" is the climax of the story. he doesn't want to expose himself to the harsh realities of the "real world", which could also be why the song uses the metaphor "school", since students are ofte n warned about said "real world". "i don't wanna be afraid of you, or of me, or the truth" further this point, because scariness is everywhere, and we all wish it wasn't like that, but we know deep inside of us that it is. the last lines, "said that girl made me feel blue, cause she told me I should stay in school, said that girl made me feel blue, don't go to school" is a nice closer, in which the narrator turns his nose to people telling him to "stay informed" or even perhaps "grow up", because all it does is make people sad. do you think this analysis is appropriate? or am i overthinking just a really catchy, danceable song? love your videos, ants just crawled out of my laptop.

     your analysis is nice but it's not quite the way i meant it. my own analysis of this song is hiding somewhere (actually several places) throughout these questions pages, and is about equal in length to yours
